entry.title: Crypto.com Obtains License to Offer Services in the Netherlands
entry.summary: Crypto.com has been licensed in the Netherlands to provide cryptocurrency services; the exchange said in a statement today (Friday). The license was awarded by the Dutch central bank (DNB) after the company met the requirements of the law passed to prevent money laundering and terrorism financing. Crypto.com Expands Operations The Netherlands is the latest country in Europe to license the Singapore-based cryptocurrency exchange. The company was awarded a Digital Asset Service Provider (DASP) license in France, while in the UK, it operates on a crypto asset business license. Additionally, the exchange is regulated in Italy, Greece, Cyprus, Spain, South Korea, and Australia. Commenting about the licensing, Kris Marszalek, the CEO of Crypto.com, said: "Collaborating wit‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: SHIB Surges to 2-Week High on Friday, Whilst TRX Extends Gains
entry.summary:
Shiba inu was a notable gainer on Friday, climbing to a two-week high during today‚Äôs session in the process. The move came as the meme coin rose by as much as 6%, despite the global crypto market cap mostly consolidating. Tron rose for a fourth straight session today.
Shiba Inu (SHIB)
Shiba inu (SHIB) rallied to a two-week high on Friday, after breaking out of a key resistance level.
SHIB/USD surged to a peak of $0.000008217 earlier in today‚Äôs session, following Thursday‚Äôs low at $0.000007754.
Friday‚Äôs move came as shiba inu broke out of a key resistance level at the $0.000008000 mark, hitting its highest point since June 15 in the process.
Another reason for today‚Äôs action appears to be the relative strength index (RSI) moving above a ceiling at 55.00.
Currently, price strength is tracking at the 60.09 level, which is marginally below a ceiling at 61.00.
Should bulls manage to race past this point, there is a good chance the next target price will be $0.000008500.
Tron (TRX)
Tron (TRX) extended a recent bull run for a fourth day, with today‚Äôs move taking the token to its highest point since last Sunday.
Following a low of $0.08221 on Thursday, TRX/USD climbed to an intraday high of $0.08417 earlier in today‚Äôs session.
Tron bulls appear to be targeting a resistance level at $0.0860, which was last hit during last Saturday‚Äôs peak of $0.0943.
Since hitting that 20-month high TRX has mostly consolidated, however bullish momentum seems to be gradually returning.
This comes after the relative strength index (RSI) moved beyond a ceiling of its own at 63.00, and is now tracking at 64.84.
If current sentiment remains, TRX could reach $0.0860 in the coming days.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
What is behind tron‚Äôs recent bull run? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Is An Appeal Coming In The Ripple Case? Here Is Gensler‚Äôs Response
entry.summary:
Following the summary judgment delivered in favor of Ripple in the ongoing XRP vs. SEC lawsuit, the Chair of the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Gary Gensler, remains taciturn on the commission‚Äôs next line of action.¬†
During a segment on Bloomberg TV, Gensler was evasive on questions bothering on whether the SEC intends to appeal the judgment. He, however, maintained that the SEC was yet to take a decision, having previously expressed disappointment over the ruling stating that the agency intends to evaluate the ruling in the Ripple Labs lawsuit.
Uncertainty Trails Gensler‚Äôs Evasiness

entry.title: US House Financial Services Committee Passes Stablecoin Legislation ‚ÄòAfter a Few Fireworks‚Äô
entry.summary:
The U.S. House Financial Services Committee has passed Chairman Patrick McHenry‚Äôs Clarity for Payment Stablecoins Act with bipartisan support. McHenry said committee members, unlike the White House, understood the urgency and importance of providing clarity for payment stablecoins. Sheila Warren, the CEO of the Crypto Council for Innovation, described the bill‚Äôs passage as the ‚Äúfirst steps toward a legislative foundation for stablecoins in the U.S.‚Äù
Landmark Legislation Close to Becoming Law
After holding negotiations for fifteen months, the U.S. House Financial Services Committee passed the Clarity for Payment Stablecoins Act on July 27 with bipartisan support. entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Hangs on to $29,000 Level, Despite Increased Market Volatility
entry.summary:
Bitcoin remained above a key support point on Friday, despite bears attempting to push the price below $29,000. Today‚Äôs session saw sentiment once again shift bearish, as U.S. consumer sentiment data looms. Ethereum was mostly unchanged in today‚Äôs session.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) continued to trade above the $29,000 mark on Friday, despite bearish pressure intensifying in today‚Äôs session.
After hitting a high of $29,520.71 on Thursday, BTC/USD dropped to an intraday low of $29,099.35 earlier in the day.
The move saw bitcoin briefly fall below a support point at $29,200, however prices have since climbed back above this point.
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
This latest slippage comes as the 10-day (red) moving average continued its downward cross versus its 25-day (blue) counterpart.
In addition to this, the relative strength index (RSI) neared a breakout below a floor at 41.00, however it has so far avoided this.
Should this take place, the next possible destination for BTC could be $28,000.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) traded above its own support point at $1,850 on Friday, as the cryptocurrency continued consolidating.
ETH/USD dropped to a bottom at $1,855.32 earlier in today‚Äôs session, a day after peaking at $1,878.43.
The price consolidation comes as the RSI failed to move above a current resistance level at 48.00.
Ethereum chart by TradingView
As of writing, the index is on the cusp of crossing this line, however momentum is still relatively weak.
There could likely be a spark later in the day, depending on how traders react to the University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment report.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcadia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.
